column4: yeah i get 200 failed passwords a day on my open ssh server(wide open on port 22)
i use winscp to connect to the sftp/scp server(in sshd)
I have putty, so i guess i also have psftp. How do i set that up ?
i dont use putty's scp client
i think its a cli based copy of scp which makes it more complex to use
winscp gives you a listing of files on both sides and a full ui
I dont really need something too fancy
scp doesnt even give a file listing
with scp you have to know the full path of the source & dest file
How does the client know the private key ?
normaly the public/private keys arent set at all
so you have to use a password
but saving the pw within winscp is less safe
still, if you have a private key, and passphrase, that should be as safe as it can get
get puttygen.exe from the putty site if you want to make a key pair
